Pre-Game Insights: On the eve of opening day at the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024, North American rivals USA and Canada have both pledged an enterprising brand of cricket.
Canada captain Saad Bin Zafar and USA’s Aaron Jones emphasized playing a 'fearless' style of cricket.
USA played pantomime villain in World Cricket League 2 in 2019, squeezing their rivals to the north out of ODI status spots.

Canada hit back in T20 World Cup qualifying pathways in the same year, though tension again came to a head when USA stole two byes to force a tie (and eventually winning a Super Over) in an Americas T20 World Cup qualifying match in 2021.
American batter Jones stated, 'We don't want to regret anything,' emphasizing their all-out attack strategy.
USA went 21 months without a T20 International, eventually turning out for seven matches across April and May.
USA brushed aside their opening match opponents 4-0 (one no-result), before a historic series win over Bangladesh 2-1 in Houston.
Canada beat Nepal by 64 runs in their ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 warm-up match.
Working under new coach and former Australia international Stuart Law, USA has been boosted by players like Shadley van Schalkwyk, Harmeet Singh, Andries Gous, and Corey Anderson.
Jones praised the newcomers and the new coach for improving team bonding and gelling.
Saad Bin Zafar emphasized that Canada wants to play quality cricket and express themselves without pressure.
The Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas, converted from a Minor League Baseball stadium, will host the first match of the tournament.
Jones expressed excitement about playing in a World Cup and praised the Grand Prairie venue.
Recent results put the Americans as favorites, though washouts for the hosts and a win for Canada over Nepal in warm-up action move the needle closer.
Jones acknowledged the psychological strains and rivalry with Canada, stating, 'It's whoever handles the pressure best tomorrow.'
Saad Bin Zafar believes both teams will entertain the crowd and represent Canada well in the World Cup.
Canada and USA feature in Group A alongside India, Pakistan, and Ireland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York may have stolen headlines from the Grand Prairie Stadium hosting the first match of the tournament.
The purpose-built cricket ground was converted from a Minor League Baseball stadium in 2020.
The upper level of the old ballpark was kept, while the lower bowl was rebuilt to fit cricketing dimensions.
The greys of rain and lingering tornado warnings of Dallas have disappeared, giving way to blue skies ahead of the match.
Limited tickets remain available for all matches in New York, including access to the Premium Club and the exclusive Diamond Club.
